Indian Economy.title: Manufacturing versus services: Why privilege one over the other?
Indian Economy.summary: While factory-led development does hold appeal for an economy like India’s, services have performed significantly better. Let’s pursue an even-handed policy between the two sectors to maximize employment growth and minimize India’s overall trade deficit.

Indian Economy.title: Mint Quick Edit | External front stability: Good news, but not entirely
Indian Economy.summary: Despite global turbulence, India’s external balances are well within safety limits in the context of the economy’s macro stability. Capital flows, though, have been disappointing.

Indian Economy.title: India’s informal sector isn’t off the map: It’s being tracked better than ever
Indian Economy.summary: Arguments of GDP over- or under-estimation fall flat in the face of statistical progress made by India to measure this sector closely. The timeliness and regularity of NSS data have improved and surveys suggest this sector’s growth has lately been robust.

Indian Economy.title: Reduce friction: Let regulated stablecoins transform India’s remittance economy
Indian Economy.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has a digital currency under trial, but it may be time for RBI-regulated rupee-pegged stablecoins to help expand the adoption of blockchain-based money. Stablecoins can make global money transfers more efficient and also enhanc…

Indian Economy.title: Barry Eichengreen: Germany’s budget expansion makes sense while America’s is reckless
Indian Economy.summary: Berlin is relaxing its austerity rule for good reasons—such as security and long-term growth—while Washington appears to have abandoned all fiscal responsibility with Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill. Where this will leave the US is a question we can’t duck.

Stock Market.title: Dynamism at work: India’s economy has led Nestle out of the Sensex
Stock Market.summary: Stock market indices must be periodically rejigged to reflect economic reality. Nestle India’s exit from the BSE Sensex—effective 23 June—is a reflection of the Indian economy’s changing structure.

Stock Market.title: A composite index of financial conditions run by RBI is a promising idea
Stock Market.summary: A financial conditions index (FCI), as proposed by a paper in RBI’s monthly bulletin for June, could aid monetary policy. But such a tool can only be an input for human judgement—and correlation must never be confused with causation.

Stock Market.title: Mint Quick Edit | India’s economy: The case for cautious optimism
Stock Market.summary: The Indian economy has proven quite resilient so far in the face of global turbulence, although some adversities persist. Looking ahead, we can’t afford to let our guard down on price threats.

Stock Market.title: Mint Quick Edit | Financial stability must deliver service efficiency
Stock Market.summary: The Reserve Bank of India’s latest ‘Financial Stability Report’ is heartening. Systemic risk is not a concern and India’s financial sector seems stable amid global flux. Stability, however, is just an enabler.

Stock Market.title: To change the world, India Inc must stop hoarding cash and take more risks
Stock Market.summary: A bet on smartphones in the 2000s turned Apple into one of the world's most valuable and influential companies, and Google's $1.65-billion buyout of YouTube in 2006 brought in more than $36 billion of revenue in 2024. Why are there are no such stories in Indi…

Startups & Funding.title: Sebi’s latest reforms will help India’s capital markets but only up to a point
Startups & Funding.summary: The regulator’s latest changes are welcome from a capital market perspective. However, in general, policymakers must always take the viewpoint of lay investors and households into account.

Startups & Funding.title: TerraPower raises $650 million from backers including Nvidia
Startups & Funding.summary: The funding round included new investors such as NVentures, the venture capital arm of Nvidia Corp., and existing backers Gates and HD Hyundai, a South Korean shipbuilder

Startups & Funding.title: India Inc is wisely betting on intrapreneurship to incubate innovation
Startups & Funding.summary: India’s next wave of ‘startup’ led growth could well emerge from within established companies that are fostering an entrepreneurial spirit. It’s easier said than done, though. Here’s what it takes.

Startups & Funding.title: Early startup backers are looking to exit in a tight market. Specialist funds swoop in
Startups & Funding.summary: A surge of global and domestic capital is chasing secondary deals as early-stage domestic funds are nearing the end of their lifecycles, pushing them to explore alternative exit routes in a tight funding environment.

Startups & Funding.title: AppsForBharat raises ₹175 crore in funding round led by Susquehanna Asia Venture
Startups & Funding.summary: The company crossed a revenue rate of  ₹100 crore in FY25 and facilitated 52 lakh online pujas and offerings at more than 70 temples across India, its founder Prashant Sachan said.

Banking & Finance.title: Premji Invest’s latest bet? A tech-powered NBFC led by a former ICICI banker
Banking & Finance.summary: The NBFC is looking to raise funds from Premji Invest and some other investors.

Banking & Finance.title: NBFC loans shrink as shadow banks turn to bonds; RBI relief fails to lift credit
Banking & Finance.summary: Experts say this slowdown is because NBFCs are preferring to raise funds through bond markets.

Banking & Finance.title: Rising asset quality on top of board's mind, HDB says ahead of IPO
Banking & Finance.summary: There are concerns over the impact of a draft RBI circular requiring banks to reduce their stakes in NBFC arms engaged in similar activities to 20%.

Banking & Finance.title: Will continue supporting HDB Financial post-IPO as well: HDFC Bank CEO
Banking & Finance.summary: Will continue supporting HDB Financial post-IPO as well: HDFC Bank CEO

Banking & Finance.title: THESE 6 NBFCs offer up to 9.10% interest on fixed deposits — check the list
Banking & Finance.summary: We give a lowdown on the FD interest rates offered by different non-banking financial institutions (NBFCs) such as ICICI Home Finance, Bajaj Finserv and Muthoot Capital, among others

Technology Sector.title: More work, per worker: How India's IT giants are earning smarter
Technology Sector.summary: Three out of India's Big Five IT companies saw an increase in revenue per worker in FY25. How did TCS, Infosys and HCL manage it?

Technology Sector.title: Siddharth Pai: India’s IT firms have a unique opportunity in AI’s trust deficit
Technology Sector.summary: Indian IT majors needn’t be at the receiving end of an AI revolution. As trust in AI is a big global worry, the use of generative AI under human supervision can generate the assurances that clients need. Domestic software companies are well placed for this.

Technology Sector.title: As TCS loses shine, investors place hopes on Infosys, HCLTech
Technology Sector.summary: TCS is losing investor favour as it trails its closest rivals Infosys and HCLTech in revenue growth and mega deals. The TCS stock now trades at a discount, raising questions about the company's ability to retain an edge in a shifting tech landscape.

Technology Sector.title: Accenture, an Indian IT bellwether? Scale, structure, and AI demand more nuance
Technology Sector.summary: Accenture’s results often lead to sharp reactions in the stocks of Indian IT services companies. However, the Dublin-headquartered tech and consulting major differs from Indian IT firms in several ways, warranting a closer look beyond its quarterly numbers.

Technology Sector.title: To change the world, India Inc must stop hoarding cash and take more risks
Technology Sector.summary: A bet on smartphones in the 2000s turned Apple into one of the world's most valuable and influential companies, and Google's $1.65-billion buyout of YouTube in 2006 brought in more than $36 billion of revenue in 2024. Why are there are no such stories in Indi…
